intro: Paradisanthus bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia paradise flower, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in warm, tropical climates and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
